_header: The best tree is ye take entent
_description: ‘A treatise of wyne’ — twenty-three macaronic quatrains

BodEngPoete1.First Lines:
The best tre if ȝe take ententInter ligna
                    fructifera…
BodEngPoete1.Last Lines:
…& bryng yor self when ye so hensvbi non siciant
                        amplius
BodEngPoete1.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Songs and Carols from a manuscript…of the Fifteenth
                Century.
Percy Society
         23. London: Richards, 1847: 53-6.

OxfBal354.First Lines:
The best tre yf ye take ententInter ligna
                    fructifera…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…& bryng them sone whan they goVbi non siscient
                        ampliusExplicit
